Link Mash (October 2, 2014)

Oct 2, 2014
1 minute read

The weekly Link Mash is a curated selection of tools, stories, and other links that I found during my travels on the web. All of my links can be found on my Pinboard; you can also find the Link Mash archives here.

  • A simple PCalc specialty calculator. I’ve been looking for a use for PCalc. Leave it to the doctor to save the day.
  • One Thing Well. A great blog that consistently highlights cool, useful software, apps, scripts, and more.
  • pawurb/termit. Google Translate in your CLI (because, why not??).
  • FGRibreau/dot-clipboard. Monitors your clipboard and executes custom scripts based on its contents.
  • wasavi. A Chrome/Firefox/Opera extension to turn form text areas into vim editors. ‘Nuff said.
  • Russell91/sshrc. My needs are a bit more complex, but this is a nifty method to configure dotfiles in a SSH session without modifying the remote server.
  • httpry. For simple HTTP request monitoring in a CLI environment, this little tool gets the job done.

This Link Mash was generated by PinPress, a simple tool to generate text templates from Pinboard data.

Theme crafted with <3 by John Otander (@4lpine).
